Ricochet will reveal to you a life which you have never lived, a ship you have never sailed, and a plane you have never flown. Ricochet, released in 2000, has remained as such a legacy in the gaming community that Valve has never bothered following it up with a sequel as they know that nothing could triumph over this classic.

"Ricochet" ist ein Online Mehrspieler First-Person Plattform-Shooter aus dem Jahre 2000.

Das Spiel von Valve läuft auf derselben Engine wie das erste "Half Life". Im Gegensatz zum legendären Meilenstein ist das hier allerdings nur ein winziges Mehrspieler-Spielchen, das wohl vor allem für den schnellen Spaß auf LAN-Parties gedacht war.

In den kleinen Arenen bewegen wir uns von einer runden Plattform zur anderen. Dabei springen wir gar nicht selber, sondern müssen nur über Pfeilsymbole gehen. Wir versuchen, unsere Gegner mit Diskuswürfen von den Plattformen zu schubsen. Fällt man in die Tiefe spawnt man nach kurzer Zeit erneut. 

Ein Diskus kann an einer gelben Fläche abprallen (daher wohl auch der Name Ricochet). Mitglieder des gegnerischen Teams mit solchen Bandenwürfen zu treffen, ist besonders elegant. 

Inspiriert wurde das Ganze wohl von dem Film "Tron" in dem es ja eine ähnliche Kampfarena gab. Eigentlich auch ein recht spaßiges Spielprinzip, das allerdings kaum Variationen bietet. Lediglich ein paar Variationen des Diskus können wir aufsammeln.

Ein noch viel größeres Problem ist aber, daß es niemand mehr spielt. In Worten: Niemand. Und einen Single-Player gibt es nicht. Wir können also nur selber einen Server erstellen und uns dann in unsere Arena stellen. Nicht wirklich Lebenssinn stiftend.

Auch für eine Partie unter Freunden, mit denen man sich verabreden müßte, taugt das Spiel nur bedingt. Es wird einfach viel zu schnell eintönig und langweilig.

Сетевой шутер от первого лица 2000 года выпуска являющийся модом для "Half Life". На этот раз нам предстоит играть за персонажей, которые перемещаются по летающим в воздухе платформам и кидают друг в друга смертельно опасные диски. Эти диски попадая в противника отталкивают его с платформы, упав с которой он падает в пропасть и умерает, также есть супер выстрел, который отрубает противнику голову, но требует долгой перезарядки. Уровни зачастую имеют ограждения сталкиваясь с которыми диски получают эффект рикошета и улетают в другую сторону. Карт в игре очень мало, и реально интересных набрать можно от силы две штуки. Онлайн в игре нет и на субботний вечер не было не одного игрока. Зато зайдя на любой сервер и побегав пару минут, есть вероятность все таки увидеть какого нибудь игрока. Стилистика игры кстати сильно напоминает "Трон". В эту игру можно спокойно играть вдвоем со своим другом, благо для этого есть режим дуэлей, где сражение происходит 1на1 до первой смерти. В целом мне понравилось. Да - игра однообразна, графика устарела, карт почти нет, онлайна нет, но в ней есть какая-то изюминка. Больше часа сражений пролетели почти незаметно и я решил, что обязательно в нее вернусь снова и может даже не один раз.

This might well be the greatest game to ever exist. First off, the graphics are nothing short of amazing. photorealistic, even. The gameplay is fast, balanced and new. This game may not seem like it has a story, but by god it does. It's a tale of hardship, friendship, and human spirit. I cried several times throughout this story, for good reason. The people you play as may not speak, but you learn their story and hardships. I wish I could go back and experience this all again, but I never will be able too. I have never played anything so brilliant in my life, and I doubt I ever will again seeing as I've played this. All the people in this game have one goal in life, that's torn away unless you don't let it. Fight your way to the top, never fall into the void. Remember you have one goal; one goal only. To become the king of Ricochet.

You will hear a lot of people here talk about how Ricochet is a dead game. Well, I'm here to tell you that this is absolutely true. That doesn't mean you shouldn't play it though. You just need to convince friends to get it or hop on and pray there are 2-6 people on some server (seriously, don't hope for more lmao). In all seriousness, it is a lot of fun and its a shame that Ricochet was never that popular.

Ricochet – A free, official Half-Life mod by Valve. It was released on November 1, 2000, and included in Half-Life's version 1.1.1.0 update, released on June 12, 2002. Ports of the game to OS X and Linux were released through Steam on August 1, 2013.

Richochet seems like a really fun game, but sadly I cannot play it whatsoever because it's a completely dead game. Going to keep this review short and to the point, unlike my other reviews.

The game is multiplayer game from Valve where you throw discs at other players, while hopping around on platforms. From gameplay footage I saw online, it looked fun, but when it came time to try it out, I couldn't get a single match going and you can't even jump around the platforms alone and throw discs into the void. 

Sadly as I said this game is absolutely dead, there isn't a single server with someone playing, unless you have a friend who can hop on with you, there's no point in buying this game. 

Also since I can't play this one, I won't be giving it any pros or cons or even a rating, cause that wouldn't be fair. 

If you liked this review please consider joining https://steamcommunity.com/groups/completingthebacklog and https://steamcommunity.com/groups/ImperialReviews
bad game

It's a fantastic party game, great with friends. The servers are mostly dead, but that just makes it easier for a group of friends to play mostly uninterrupted by random players. It's unique, looks really good for the GoldSRC engine, and it overall a blast. I'd definitely recommend getting it for yourself and a few friends, especially since it's so cheap!

I got this game in a Valve bundle that came with all the games they have ever made. Definitely not the game I was most excited to play. I think I may have tried playing it once or twice before. Today, I tried playing it again. Only like 7 servers that were someone stall running, all completely empty. According to Steamcharts, this game has at most 5 people playing at a time, and has an all time peak of around 87. The only way I could see recommending this game is if you get a bunch of friends to buy it and play it only with them (and that's assuming the game is actually any fun). Other than that, no real reason to play or buy this game.
